intro: Mutisia inflexa var. melanopoga, commonly known as the black-leaved mutisia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are dark green and sometimes have a slightly pubescent surface, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. This variant is distinguished by its darker foliage compared to other varieties of Mutisia inflexa.
